data: Refer to latest BC CDC - COVID-19 Therapeutics Committee Guidelines for most up-to-date criteria
Avoid unnecessary imaging and frequent labwork. Minimize patient transportation. Use once daily meds if possible
COVID-19: Do not initiate any IV fluids without an order from provider
Do not place Allied Health Consult order without confirmation from provider
Droplet and Contact, COVID-19, use appropriate eye protection
If/when patient requires 4L/min of oxygen by nasal prongs to keep SpO2 at 92% or above, then call CCOT (if available at your site) and provider
If/when patient requires 6L/min of oxygen by nasal prongs to keep SpO2 at 92% or above, then notify provider for referral to ICU
Judicious fluid and allow relative hypotension in absence of worsening shock (lactate/ acute renal failure)
For COVID-19 antimicrobial and immunomodulatory therapy refer to the Covid-19 Treatment PowerPlan
ACE inhibitors, ARBs, NSAIDS and prednisone should not be discontinued solely on the basis of COVID-19

Nebulizers can be ordered and administered if the patient is in a single room with door closed, or dedicated COVID ward with personnel wearing appropriate PPE.  Do not order MDIs preferentially as supply of bronchodilator inhalers is limited. Order selectively for appropriate clinical indications (e.g wheezing)
Dexamethasone is strongly recommended for patients requiring mechanical ventilation and recommended for hospitalized patients requiring supplemental oxygen

Therapeutic anticoagulation for COVID-19 may be considered in patients:
-Without high risk features for serious bleeding
AND
-Who do NOT require organ support

High risk features for bleeding include age 75 years or greater; creatinine clearance less than 30 mL/min; any coagulopathy; platelet count less than 50 x 10^9/L; use of dual antiplatelet therapy; recent history of serious GI bleed or recent intracranial condition (stroke; neurosurgery; aneurysm, cancer)
If ordered, therapeutic anticoagulation for COVID-19 should start within 72 hours of admission

If patient remains in hospital after 14 days of therapeutic anticoagulation for COVID-19, either:
-Start VTE prophylaxis if indicated. Refer to risk factors for VTE 
OR
-Continue therapeutic anticoagulation for other pre-existing indication (e.g. atrial fibrillation)
For weight greater than 160 kg, contact hematologist to discusss use of unfractionated heparin infusion

For Patients NOT ordered Therapeutic anticoagulation for COVID-19

COMPLETE RISK SCORING FIRST, THEN USE SCORE TO CHOOSE PROPHYLAXIS OPTION BELOW:
IMPROVE VTE Risk Factors
- Previous VTE = 3 points
- Acquired or Familial Thrombophilia * = 2 points
- Active Cancer = 2 points
- Lower Limb Paralysis = 2 points
- Critical Care Stay = 1 point
- Predicted immobilization 7 days or more ** = 1 point
- Age greater than 60 years = 1 point
* Includes conditions known to increase risk of thrombosis such as antiphospholipid syndrome, sepsis, and acute severe inflammatory conditions associated with markedly elevated CRP. Use clinical judgment
**Immobilization = confined to bed/chair during and/or prior to admission
No anticoagulant or no mechanical prophylaxis required
HIGH RISK (IMPROVE VTE Score = 2 or greater)

Order pharmacologic prophylaxis except when:
- Active bleeding of clinical significance requiring intervention 
- High risk of serious bleeding or bleeding into a critical site (e.g. intracranial, epidural, pericardial, intraocular, retroperitoneal, intra-articular) 
- Known major bleeding disorder or acquired coagulopathy (consider Hematology consult) 
- Platelet count less than 50 x 10^9/L (consider Hematology consult) 
- If history of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT), DO NOT give LMWH or heparin. Consider fondaparinux (listed below) or consult Hematology / Internal Medicine for use of an alternative agent if eGFR less than 30 mL/min
- Patient already receiving therapeutic anticoagulation
Contraindication: Risk of Serious Bleed in Critical Site
Contraindication: Platelet Count Less Than 50 x 10^9/L
Contraindication: Hx of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia, DO NOT give LMWH or heparin

Mechanical prophylaxis contraindicated in:
- Peripheral vascular disease with absent pedal pulses
- Severe peripheral neuropathy
- Skin breakdown, ulcers, gangrene, cellulitis, or dermatitis
- Skin grafting within last 3 months
- Allergy to stocking or compression cuff materials
- Unable to size or apply properly due to deformity, recent surgery or trauma
- Acute stroke with immobility (unable to walk independently to the toilet) should not use graduated compression stockings or calf-length / below the knee Sequential Compression Devices. Thigh-length / full leg Sequential Compression Device should be utilized
